column4: I need a way to get 3dsmax and photoshop working in ubuntu though, or I'm going back to windows
I use both for work and often work from home
photoshop will work with wine
that still leaves photoshop
use wine http://www.buntudot.org/people/~imbrandon/screenshots/snapshot4.png
not sure about 3dsmax
you can also run windows inside of linux, via vm software and its more stable
I've heard that it's considerably slower in a VM
not from what i have heard, nor what i have seen my friends doing
have you tried to see if there was a problem in linux like 3dsmax?
I did a lot of research before switching to ubuntu, and saw several people on the net claiming to have max working via cedega
look at crossover office for 3dsmax, i use crossover when i need project or visio
http://www.codeweavers.com/compatibility/browse/name
http://www.codeweavers.com/compatibility/browse/name?letter=p;cw=d92dce7b5b4e9e78af15dc7ffaa525ea;order=app_name;sort=ASC;curPos=50 for photoshop
thats what i would suggest
all well and good, but they are listing 3dsmax as untested, and I need both apps to work flawlessly
why can't you test it
is that list for wine, or for crossover office?
crossover office
is there a free demo of crossover? I'm not going to pay to test it
there should be
http://www.codeweavers.com/products/download_trial
